abstract.text: Initializes a task object with the specified content and triggers.

inlineContent.text: The title text that describes the task. This string is what the user enters for the task details.
The current state of the task. Tasks can be completed or not completed.
Information about how the task behaves in your app. Use this parameter to specify whether the task can be marked as completed.
A location-based trigger that reminds the user to complete the task.
A time-based trigger that reminds the user to complete the task.
The date on which the task was initially created.
The last date on which the task was updated.
The unique identifier that your app uses to identify the task.
An initialized task object or
if the object could not be created.

abstract.text: Empower people to customize interactions for your app on their device.

A custom phrase to be resolved by an Intents extension.
An individual task the user needs to complete.
Initializes a task object with the specified content and triggers.
Initializes a task object with the specified content and triggers.
Constants indicating the completion state of a task.
Constants indicating how the task behaves.
A trigger condition based on a date or time.
A static, plain-text Unicode string object which you use when you need reference semantics or other Foundation-specific behavior.
A date or time specified in terms of units (such as year, month, day, hour, and minute) to be evaluated in a calendar system and time zone.
A Unicode string value that is a collection of characters.
